setup.exitText: Thank you for completing my test. This was an evaluation of computational ideas of composition and its different approaches. The data you have provided will be used to evaluate the computational compositions to identify a pathway forwards to use computers to aid in composing for musicians. Please direct any queries to: harriet.drury@students.plymouth.ac.uk

surveycheckbox.name: Age
surveycheckbox.statement: Please select the age range applicable to you.

surveycheckbox.name: experience
surveycheckbox.statement: Please self evaluate your musical experience
surveycheckbox.option: I like to listen to music, but do not play any instruments
I have played an instrument, but have not studied music composition
I have studied music composition in a formal setting
I am a teacher or researcher in music

surveycheckbox.name: participation
surveycheckbox.statement:
This test is designed to evaluate different computer designs and approaches to composing music. The clips provided are either generated from a computer or human. Please rate each clip based on personal preference, coherence and enjoyability. Note that each melody is void of characteristics to make a level playing field. Please listen to each melody first before rating them.
By pressing okay you agree to take part in this study. At any point in the test you are free to leave and no finish without giving a reason.
Press okay to continue

surveyquestion.name: CAC
surveyquestion.statement: What is your previous experience of computer composition?

surveyquestion.name: thoughts
surveyquestion.statement: What is your opinion on computer based compositions?

surveyquestion.name: Use
surveyquestion.statement: Would you use computer aided compositional ideas in your own work? Please explain why you would or would not use.
